intro: Cyphia digitata var. trimera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Cyphia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and has a compact, upright growth habit. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
